posts.post_content:
Well, it took me 4 years to complete (and sell) a 520 T206 Peidmont/SC (PB) set.

Now been working 6 years on a T206 "mid-tier" back set (still in progress ;))

So, I figure, time for something new ...... T207s !!!!

I collect (and prefer) raw, but graded is OK.

Pure budget set:

Recruit Commons -- g/vg range -- 40-50

HOFs (sans Johnson) -- good range -- 200-300

Broad Leaf / Cycle -- good range -- 200-300

If you might have anything that may fit:

[url]mybuddyinc@yahoo.com[/url]

(no PMS, please)

Thanks, Scott
Scott: ive got these raw t207's if any work. Tom

I got some very nice cards from first post ............ :)

So, let's give it another shot .............. ;)

[url]mybuddyinc@yahoo.com[/url]

Thanks, Scott :rolleyes:

.............. Ground Hogs Day bump ............. :p


[url]mybuddyinc@yahoo.com[/url]


Thanks, Scott :rolleyes:

I think I have some doubles…will check over the weekend.


Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk

..................... "everyday is Mother's Day" ................ bump ....... :)

[url]mybuddyinc@yahoo.com[/url]

Thanks, Scott

I was just thinking of how long I've been collecting T207s, and this thread answered my question -- about 13 months.

I had a pretty good year, and now sit at 180 / 205 ............. :)

Only two HOFs need:

Carey
Speaker :p

Four "reasonable" BLs:

Barney Pelty 
Don Carlos Ragan 
Victor Saier 
George Tyler 

17 Commons:

Neal Ball 
Jimmy Blocke 
Howard Camnitz 
William Carrigan 
Tom Clarke 
Clyde Engle 
Ray Fisher (blue cap) 
Ray Fisher (white cap)
Del Gainor 
Lefty George 
Casey Hageman 
Elmer Knetzer 
Napoleon Rucker 
Wilbur Schardt 
Jim Scott 
William Sullivan 
Ivey Wingo 

One of those "odd" collecting incidences -- Have all other variations, but neither Fisher ....... :o

Still on budget in first post.  However will consider paying more for Anon. 3 commons (Napoleons are way cool, but not in my wheel house at this time)

[url]mybuddyinc@yahoo.com[/url]

Thanks, Scott
